website_summaries.verdict: The Asus ZenPad S 8.0 strikes a good balance between price and features, with performance on par with more expensive Android tablets.

customer_reviews.title: Hardware: every bit of your money's worth.
customer_reviews.text: Software: not so good. Too much bloated. Hopefully in the future.. there may be some custom ROMs available to boot it up with. Its definetely Marshmellow-capable Asus, you need to keep ur software simple, and it would be prudent if you give us a choice to 'uninstall & delete' your crap. Give ur users something they want to use. Not things that you want them to use. Your hardwares are your major strengths, dont load them with useless software & bring urself disrepute.
customer_reviews.author: SatGov

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Superb tablet for the price. Perfect size and aspect ratio. Very quick, no lag. Lovely screen. ZenUI is actually very good, definitely a significant improvement on stock android and very customisable; Lots of bloat on initial startup but it can all be either uninstalled or disabled. Needed to invest 30 mins in setting up properly. Feels like a premium device; feels a lot better than the plasticy Tab S2 to me. Getting about 6 hours screen-on time of continued web browsing. Overall unrivalled at this price. Battery life could be better but am happy with the trade off in terms of performance and slim design. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Davejones

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this tablet. The build quality and finish is excellent and the unit is very light. The quality of the screen is superb amazingly sharp picture and the response is instant. This product looks and feels much more expensive then the sub £200 price point would suggest. An absolute bargain.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tablet for the money.
customer_reviews.text: *I should say up front, only had tablet a few days and upgraded from a very old tablet running Android 4.4.2.* Very pleased with my ASUS Zenpad! Nice screen clarity, good battery and nice designed. Especially like the dual speakers which give a nice sound to my music. I mostly use it to read but having moved from a 7" to an 8" tablet I find it nice and light. Would recommend to those wanting a nice quality tablet at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Russ S

customer_reviews.title: An almost perfect Android tablet
customer_reviews.text: An almost perfect Android tablet. At least, as a techno-dumbo and seasoned ipad user, that's how it seems to me. Small enough to go into a pocket or handbag, so also invaluable replacement for defunct e-reader. a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: J Wood

customer_reviews.title: I used Nexus 7 made also by Asus before and I wasn't disappointed with my upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is well made with high quality finish. I used Nexus 7 made also by Asus before and I wasn't disappointed with my upgrade. It's good for my use, as a web browsing, movie watching, book reading, sat nav running and game playing device.
customer_reviews.author: S. Czerwinski

customer_reviews.title: Asus bloatware
customer_reviews.text: Full of bloatware. I never understood why we can't have an Android tablet that has simple interface and is not overloaded with twenty useless applications that you can't uninstall.
customer_reviews.author: DesignThinker

customer_reviews.title: good as 1st tablet.
customer_reviews.text: Not used greatly yet. does not show .MOV files, but found VLC app that does. Could have got it cheaper at John Lewis, so was overpriced. selected this as it will many be for showing images and has good graphics.

customer_reviews.text: Had this for a week now, apps crashing all the time screen not Responding to touch not impressed. think its getting sent back

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Shame it didn't arrive with a UK plug, only a two pin European one :-( or English instructions ??

customer_reviews.title: ASUS did it again ... exceptional tablet I wouldn't hesitate to recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love my zenpad s. I bought this after finding out my kindle allow me to use apps from the storage card. This was just the thing for what I wanted it took me a little while to get used to the touch pad as it's a little different from my padfone but it's an absolute delight to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good but.........
customer_reviews.text: What a pity..... Seems a brilliant tablet, very fast and a very high screen res, have an old ipad and this asus seemed a lot quicker. On arrival it updated to android 6 no probs, but....... The problem was the wifi just kept on dropping out, even after a factory reset it would only last about ten minutes or so before dropping out. Such a shame, in total i have 8 other devices all happy on the internet but this tablet just refused to stay connected. It will be going back unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Fozzy

customer_reviews.title: Great but charging it is a mega marathon
customer_reviews.text: I bought one 2 days ago. I was pretty excited about it - it is so light weight and smart, a cracking good tablet. BUT, I put it on to charge and 15 hours later it's only 32% fully charged! I was inclined to give it a full 5 stars but right now it's headed for no stars. Hence my split vote of 3 stars! What is going on? More accurately, what is not going on?
customer_reviews.author: Richard
